reformulated: Black's last move, Ra7, was an oversight that could lead to significant material loss. White capitalized on this mistake by playing Nxc6, which not only simplifies the position but also gains a knight. Following up with c3, White strengthens their control over the center while White's Ng4 pins the Black queen to the king. White's Nxc8 recaptures the knight, allowing Black to recapture with Qxc8, which becomes a precarious queen position. White's move Bxa7 sacrifices another piece for the same reason, aiming to win a pawn and open lines against the Black king. This tactical sequence shows that Black's last move was a blunder that could have been easily exploited by White.
